Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments, including 1886,0601.476b) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and rosette in faded added white outline with faded added red centre; exterior: dot and billet pattern at rim above maeander band between lines; below, painted decoration consisting of antithetical composition of two sirens or sphinxes (only heads remaining with each wearing a very small square polos); pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0562) (phase 2)
